STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 28, 2024
Frederick Walraven
ENNIS CENTER FOR CHILDREN - SAGINAW
3095 CABARET TRL S,
SAGINAW, MI, 48603-2284
RE: License#: CB730410102
Dear Frederick Walraven:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/20/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency Interim Evaluation completed 8/8/2023 identified one violation related to
Rule 327(5) (d). The CAP was approved 9/25/2023 and no repeat violations were
identified as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The assessment indicated the
CAP that was implemented provided improved supervisory guidance to ensure

improved staff performance and compliance. The assessment also provided a
review of the key performance indicators of the agency.
Financial Overview
The agency's most recent independent financial audit dated 9/30/2023 was
reviewed. There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the
facility's budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff reported feeling
supported by the agency. Supervisors and coworkers are available to assist as
needed. Staff did not report any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The analyst identified one safety concern in a home that required a
carbon monoxide detector and smoke detector.
Resolution: The agency provided photo documentation the required detectors were
provided and installed.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
5/24/2024
